assetIdentification.assetDescription: Central display interface for controlling vehicle infotainment, navigation, climate, and vehicle settings, providing visual feedback and user interaction capabilities

riskAssessment.title: Display Content Tampering Risk
riskAssessment.description: Risk associated with an attacker manipulating the content displayed on the Head Unit to show false information, conceal warnings, or create misleading user interface elements

impactRating.justification: Tampering with displayed information could lead to driver confusion, missed warnings, incorrect vehicle status information, and potentially unsafe driving behaviors

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Attack requires local or adjacent network access and significant privileges, with moderate technical complexity

riskLevel.justification: High impact combined with medium attack feasibility results in high overall risk

securityNeed.justification: High risk level requires strong security controls to maintain display content integrity

riskAssessment.riskTreatmentJustification: The risk must be mitigated due to potential safety implications and the role of the head unit in providing critical vehicle information to the driver

recommendedControls.title: Display Content Integrity Verification
recommendedControls.description: Implement cryptographic verification of all display content prior to rendering

recommendedControls.title: Critical Warning Redundancy
recommendedControls.description: Implement redundant display mechanisms for safety-critical warnings

recommendedControls.title: Rendering Pipeline Security Hardening
recommendedControls.description: Enhance security of the rendering pipeline with memory protection and integrity checks

recommendedControls.title: Display Content Anomaly Detection
recommendedControls.description: Implement monitoring for unexpected changes in display content or rendering behavior

riskAssessment.title: Touch Input Command Injection Risk
riskAssessment.description: Risk associated with an attacker injecting false touch input commands or manipulating legitimate touch inputs to trigger unintended actions or prevent user control of vehicle functions

impactRating.justification: Manipulation of touch inputs could lead to unintended vehicle control actions, system configurations, or denial of legitimate user inputs

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Attack requires local access with low privileges but high technical complexity

riskLevel.justification: Medium impact combined with medium attack feasibility results in medium overall risk

securityNeed.justification: Medium risk level requires appropriate security controls to ensure touch input integrity

riskAssessment.riskTreatmentJustification: The risk must be mitigated to ensure proper control of vehicle functions through the touch interface

recommendedControls.title: Touch Input Validation Enhancement
recommendedControls.description: Implement comprehensive validation of touch input events for plausibility and proper format

recommendedControls.title: Input Rate Limiting
recommendedControls.description: Implement rate limiting for touch input events to prevent flooding attacks

recommendedControls.title: Critical Function Confirmation
recommendedControls.description: Require explicit confirmation for safety or security sensitive touch commands

recommendedControls.title: Touch Input Authentication
recommendedControls.description: Implement mechanisms to verify the authenticity of touch input sources

riskAssessment.title: Screen Scraping Attack Risk
riskAssessment.description: Risk associated with an attacker capturing sensitive information displayed on the Head Unit screen, including personal data, credentials, navigation history, and vehicle settings

impactRating.justification: Exposure of sensitive user information could lead to privacy violations, regulatory non-compliance, and potential financial harm to users

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Attack requires only local access with low privileges and low complexity, with multiple potential attack vectors

riskLevel.justification: High impact combined with high attack feasibility results in critical overall risk

securityNeed.justification: Critical risk level requires strong security controls to protect sensitive information displayed on screen

riskAssessment.riskTreatmentJustification: The risk must be mitigated due to privacy implications and regulatory requirements for protecting user data

recommendedControls.title: Display Buffer Memory Protection
recommendedControls.description: Implement memory protection mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access to display buffer

recommendedControls.title: Sensitive Data Masking
recommendedControls.description: Implement automatic masking of sensitive information (account numbers, passwords, etc.) on display

recommendedControls.title: Screen Capture Prevention
recommendedControls.description: Implement controls to detect and prevent unauthorized screen capture

recommendedControls.title: Debug Interface Security
recommendedControls.description: Disable or strictly limit debug interfaces in production systems

securityRequirements.title: Display Content Integrity
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall verify the integrity of all display content before rendering

verification.description: Penetration testing of display content manipulation

securityRequirements.title: Critical Warning Protection
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall implement redundant display mechanisms for safety-critical warnings that cannot be overridden

verification.description: Safety testing with simulated attack conditions

securityRequirements.title: Touch Input Validation
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall validate all touch input events for authenticity, format, and plausibility

verification.description: Fuzz testing of touch input handling

securityRequirements.title: Critical Function Confirmation
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall require explicit confirmation for safety or security-sensitive touch commands

securityRequirements.title: Display Buffer Protection
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall implement memory protection to prevent unauthorized access to display buffer content

verification.description: Security testing for memory protection bypass

securityRequirements.title: Sensitive Data Protection
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall automatically mask sensitive information on screen and implement mechanisms to prevent screen capture

securityRequirements.title: Debug Interface Security
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall disable or strictly limit debug interfaces in production systems

verification.description: Security testing for debug interface access

securityRequirements.title: Input Rate Limiting
securityRequirements.description: The Head Unit shall implement rate limiting for touch input events to prevent flooding attacks

relatedRequirements.description: The head unit shall provide a user interface for controlling vehicle systems
The head unit shall display vehicle status information to the user
The head unit shall protect user data from unauthorized access
The head unit shall process user inputs accurately

contentSummary: This TARA Risk Assessment document analyzes the security risks associated with the Head Unit Display function and defines security requirements to address these risks. Three primary risks are assessed: Display Content Tampering Risk (RISK-HU-01), which is rated as high risk due to potential safety implications; Touch Input Command Injection Risk (RISK-HU-02), which is rated as medium risk affecting vehicle control; and Screen Scraping Attack Risk (RISK-HU-03), which is rated as critical risk due to privacy and data protection concerns. For each risk, the document provides recommended controls with implementation priorities, such as display content verification, input validation, and memory protection mechanisms. The document defines eight specific security requirements targeting these risks, all planned for implementation and verification through various testing methods. These requirements range from display content integrity verification to sensitive data protection and debug interface security. The document establishes traceability to impact analysis and threat scenarios, ensuring a complete risk management approach for the Head Unit Display function.
